meanings.definition: The outline or shape of a roof.
meanings.sent1: The rooflines of the house were straight and simple.
meanings.sent2: I could see the rooflines of the buildings from afar.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel ran along the rooflines, playing a game of tag.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the rooflines of the city resembled a jagged mountain range.
meanings.sent5: The artist painted the rooflines with bold, contrasting colors to make them stand out.

meanings.definition: The lines formed by the edges of a roof.
meanings.sent1: Rainwater cascaded down the rooflines during the storm.
meanings.sent2: The snow accumulated along the rooflines, creating a picturesque scene.
meanings.sent3: The curious cat walked along the rooflines, trying to balance on the narrow edges.
meanings.sent4: The moonlight cast shadows of the rooflines on the ground, creating a mysterious pattern.
meanings.sent5: The old house had intricate rooflines that added character to the neighborhood.

meanings.definition: The overall design or style of a roof.
meanings.sent1: The modern architecture featured sleek and minimalist rooflines.
meanings.sent2: The historic buildings in the town had ornate rooflines with intricate details.
meanings.sent3: The playful children imagined the rooflines as giant waves in the sky.
meanings.sent4: The rooflines of the castle soared high into the clouds, symbolizing strength and power.
meanings.sent5: The unique rooflines of the pagoda captured the attention of all visitors.
